Which World Cup final was tied and the super over was also tied? How was the winner decided and who won the final?
column3:
The 2019 ICC Men’s ODI World Cup final was held at Lord’s, London, between England and New Zealand. The match ended in a tie with both teams scoring 241 runs.

In the subsequent Super Over, both teams again scored the same number of runs.

However, England was declared the winner based on the boundary countback rule, as they had scored more boundaries in their innings.


This was England’s first World Cup title.
